reviews.text: The station is set out over several levels and the lifts are inadequate! They are too small and are often filled with urine! There are no toilets and there are very few places to sit.
Station is just fine I guess, it does the job. However there can be a lot of climbing stairs to get to different platforms, and that can be very frustrating when you're running late for the train.

Smethwich Galton Bridge does it's job as an interchange station decently well I guess. However, it can be very easy to get confused if you changing trains between different platforms or even trying to exit the station. The lower level platforms lack alot of seating and shelter, with fast trains frequently passing through. 

Trains are more frequent on the upper level but the lifts are quite small with a limited capacity. Buses stop right outside of the station, near the ticket office and I'll at least say it looks quite nice as a station.

Just completed a lengthy review of this train station and when I attempted to add photos I lost the lot, many thanks Google!
No parking on the frontage.
No counter assistant, so pay the world's slowest self-service machine.
On the plus side, a wonderful view of the 1812Galton Bridge. Two levels of tracks so the station serves many destination s
